messages.messageBody:
what is the original version?anyway...in inagakis version it is Tawaraboshi Gemba who is guarding the bridge,played by Mifune Toshiro....(version is 1962 chuushingura...)regards..Jore


To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.comFrom: allan_fan@...: Thu, 20 Dec 2007 11:03:54 -0800Subject: [samuraihistory] 48th Ronin/Samurai




Recently, I saw the original version of the 47 Ronin/Samurai, Genroku Chushingura.Who was the Ronin guarding the bridge?His name used in the movie and the actual actor portraying him?[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: A SHINTO WEBSITE DISCOVERY...
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, From a friend of mine in the UK to a Nihonto discussion list.  A VERY worthy discovery. Best regards Barry Thomas. ... Shinto as in shrines and
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,
From a friend of mine in the UK to a Nihonto discussion list. A VERY worthy discovery.
Best regards
Barry Thomas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Shinto as in shrines and temples, rather than swords. A comprehensive, encyclopaedic, cross-referenced online resource written by Japanese authorities at Kokugakuin University and translated into excellent English (also German, French, Russian chapter introductions). It is the "Establishment of a National Learning Institute for the Dissemination of Research on Shinto and Japanese Culture", essentially all you could want to know.



http://eos.kokugakuin.ac.jp/modules/xwords/



Found by sheer fluke, that most productive mechanism of locating stuff.



Dunckx


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
